item.title: Report X-2024081848
item.description:
Report X-2024081848

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-29T09:23:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-17
  • City: TUKWILA
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: LEAKING STEEL DRUM WAS DISCOVERED BY AN AUDITOR WHO THEN NOTIFIED A RESPONDER. ALL PPE (GLOVES, GOGGLES, BOOTS, APRON, SILVER LINING) WAS PUT ON AND DRUM WAS PLACED INTO A YELLOW TUB/DMP BAG. DRUM WAS THEN TRANSFERRED TO THE DMP FOR FURTHER PROCESSING. ALL TUBS/PPE WERE THEN DECONTAMINATED AND DRUM WAS FURTHER PROCESSED INTO ETT.

item.title: Report X-2024081737
item.description:
Report X-2024081737

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-28T15:13:27+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-23
  • City: EAST WENATCHEE
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Package came out of trailer during AM sort with the bottom half of the package wet. The contents leaked on one other package, and was able to be repacked. Upon retail inspection found one jug of Neutral Disinfectant Cleaner 2.5 gallons inside of a plastic bag. One cap on solid, sides of plastic have a slight indent in sides. Leaking from a crack in the seam. No damage to outer package found other than it being wet.

item.title: Report E-2024080441
item.description:
Report E-2024080441

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-28T15:13:27+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-30
  • City: TACOMA
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: NRC ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Driver was taking load to PRS (Disposal Facility) when he noticed the smell of diesel when he entered the facility. When he looked back, he noticed that he could see liquid coming from the black valve on top of the tanker. PRS directed him to park in an area to contain the potential release. Once the driver pulled over, he called the ER team who was dispatched to investigate the roadway for the release and clean any impact at PRS. When the ER response team arrived at the area, they discovered no product on the roadway and only staining in the driveway and parking area of PRS. The disposal facility took responsibility of the product clean up. Based on the team’s findings it was determined the release to be well under 5 gallons. The source of the release was deemed to be the valve on top of the tank. The tank was emptied at the disposal facility and washed out. It was taken back to the yard where the vehicle was red tagged. The valve has since been replaced.

item.title: Report X-2024081608
item.description:
Report X-2024081608

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-27T06:25:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-16
  • City: DUPONT
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Package was brought to QA with visible leakage and a strong odor. Upon further inspection it is revealed that the drum had a loose lid/ seal failure leading to the spill, we believed it to be non hazardous at first. We had to reach out to the shipper to get the SDS which caused the initial delay in the DPR, however when provided the transport section did not have any information about it being hazardous, but we suspected it being hazardous because of the SDS chemical composition as well as the GHS classifications listed. We processed the DPR and ISF and asked for an updated SDS from the shipper and the delay from then to filling out an incident report was because the shipper sent us an SDS with the transport information today, however the SDS itself seems to have some conflicting items as it is classified as non hazardous but a UN#, class, as well as packing group were provided right below , it also has acute toxicity NFPA label and a skull and crossbones GHS label but no other information in the transport section about them. The proper shipping name I entered is what I found on the ERG however one was not provided on the SDS. I will include both SDS's for reference.

item.title: Report E-2024080557
item.description:
Report E-2024080557

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-26T06:17:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-19
  • City: UNION GAP
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: RANGER LANDSTAR INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 7000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On August 19, 2024, at 1617 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar personnel in Union Gap, Washington regarding the release of Transchem Muriatic Acid. Contractors were dispatched to the site to perform all onsite clean-up activities. Upon arrival, contractors confirmed the release of a total of 2 gallons of Transchem Muriatic Acid (UN1789, Hydrochloric Acid Solution, 8, II) from a box containing (4) 1-gallon plastic pails. The release was due to a load shift and impacted a 6ft x 6ft area on the trailer floor and the outer boxes of other cargo. Contractors neutralized and cleaned the release with absorbents and the proper PPE. Thirty-four 1-gallon plastic pails of recovered product were collected and containerized in (2) 55-gallon DF’s. All waste was containerized in (1) 55-gallon DM, and (1) 55-gallon DF, then taken offsite by contractors for proper disposal.
